I'm Sudarsan

More About Me

About Me

Hi! I'm Sudarsan Srinivasan, a Mechanical and Product Design Engineer with 3.5+ years of experience in the automotive industry, now pursuing a Master's in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Washington.

I specialize in mechanical design (CAD, DFM/DFA, GD&T, FEA) and integrate cross-disciplinary skills in mechatronics, robotics, and automation to build future-ready systems.

At Bajaj Auto, I led designs across engine systems, structural components, and cost-saving projects. Now, I'm expanding into robotics and control systems through research and hands-on projects.

Work Experience

The Boring Company

Integration Engineering SolidWorks Cross-functional Collaboration Design for Manufacturability (DFM) Project Scheduling Risk Mitigation Documentation

As an Integration Engineering Intern at The Boring Company (Bastrop, TX), I work on reviewing designs for performance, manufacturability, and simplicity, while driving execution of critical-path items to support smooth prototype and production builds.

Bajaj Auto Limited

Mechanical Design Siemens NX GD&T Die casting Injection molding Machining DFM/DFA FEA (ANSYS, HyperView) 8D Root Cause Analysis DFMEA, DVP, DRBFM Cross functional Collaboration NXOpen Automation VAVE, Cost optimization

As a Mechanical Design Engineer, I led design and development of aluminum castings, plastic covers, gaskets - both metal & fiber, and sheet metal brackets, for ICE (2Wh) and EV platforms (3Wh), adhering to regulatory norms, styling, DFMEA, and production feasibility for high-volume production

Ashok Leyland

Process Optimization SOP and WIS documentation Quality Control Data collection and Analysis Pareto chart analysis Documentation Cross-functional Collaboration

As an intern, I worked on two key projects to improve commercial vehicle manufacturing processes - focused on assembly line process optimization and quality improvements.

Rane TRW Steering Systems

Time study analysis Process optimization Design Engineering CAD Modeling Product Validation SolidWorks for CAD design On-ground implementation and testing

As an intern, focus was on optimizing the drop-arm painting process.Achieved significant improvements in production efficiency and output through process analysis and custom equipment design.

Projects

Boeing Advanced Research Collaboration @ UW

Mechanical Design CAD Modeling (Solidworks) System Integration Cross-functional Collaboration Material Selection IP65 Design Actuator Design

Leading mechanical design for an autonomous cleaning robot for non-destructive inspection water tank cells

Analysis of Rigging Plate

ANSYS Mechanical Stress Analysis Mesh Convergence & Validation Studies SolidWorks Finite Element Analysis (FEA) Engineering Design

Detailed structural and stress analysis of rigging plate components for lifting and hoisting applications

Analysis of Roof Truss

ANSYS Mechanical Structural Analysis Finite Element Analysis (FEA) Load Calculation Stress Analysis Engineering Calculations CAD Modeling Material Properties

Structural analysis of roof truss systems using finite element methods and engineering principles

Pacman Capture the Flag AI Contest

Python Object-Oriented Programming Search Algorithms & Pathfinding Multi-Agent Systems Algorithm Design Game AI Adversarial AI Strategy Development

Design and implement intelligent agents to compete in a multi-player "Capture the Flag" variant of Pacman with offensive and defensive strategies as part of coursework

Safe End-Effector Trajectory Tracking for a 2-DOF Robotic Arm

MATLAB Simulink Control Theory

Designed a CLF-CBF QP controller to ensure safe and stable trajectory tracking under dynamic constraints.

Modeling Heat Transfer in Metal Quenching using Peridynamic Continuum Modeling

MATLAB Peridynamics Heat Transfer Modeling

Developed and validated a Peridynamic heat transfer model to analyze temperature profiles during metal quenching, extending classical DC casting theories.
